intro: Ligustrum quihoui var. brachystachyum, commonly known as the Chinese privet or narrow-leaved privet, is a shrub native to China. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces dark blue to black berries that are edible for birds but toxic to humans. It is often used in landscaping due to its adaptability and tolerance to various soil conditions. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in urban environments make it a common ornamental plant.
